revisions.rev:
{{dablink|This article is about 16bit the music act. For 16-bit in computer architecture, see [[16-bit]]. For the era of computer gaming commonly referred to as ''16-bit'', see [[History of video game consoles (fourth generation)]]}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = 16bit | image = 16bit Press Pic 2011.jpg | caption = 16bit Press Picture 2011 | image_size = 150px | image = | background = group_or_band | alias = | origin = [[London]], United Kingdom | genre = [[UK Bass]], [[Electronic music|Electronic]], [[Dubstep]] | years_active = 2008-present | label = [[Chase and Status#MTA Records|MTA]] | associated_acts = | website =[http://www.facebook.com/16bitmusic/ www.facebook.com/16bitmusic] | current_members = Eddie Jefferys (2008-Present)
Jason Morrison (2008-Present) | past_members = }} '''16bit''' are an electronic music act from [[London]], UK, consisting of Eddie Jefferys and Jason Morrison.[{{cite journal |journal=Dazed & Confused |year=2011 |month=August |page=18}} BjÃ¶rk selects 16bit] They are signed to Chase & Status' MTA Records.[http://www.kmag.co.uk/editorial/features/chase-and-status-interview-0111.html K Mag interviews Chase & Status] ==Biography== 16bit are electronic music artists best known for producing [[dubstep]]. 16bit's debut release, in 2009, was "In The Death Car EP" which featured the track "Chainsaw Calligraphy" recognised for its innovative qualities at the time.[http://lineout.thestranger.com/lineout/archives/2009/02/05/16_bit_chainsaw_calligraphy The Stranger Music review - 16 Bit : "Chainsaw Calligraphy"] 14 of 16bit's songs were used as the soundtrack for the [[Iphone]] and [[WiiWare]] video game Lilt Line.[http://liltline.com/#music Lilt Line soundtrack] They have produced [[BjÃ¶rk]]'s first single off her 2011 album 'Biophillia', among other tracks. British rapper [[Professor Green]] announced via Twitter that 16bit are producing his single "[[At Your Inconvenience (song)|At Your Inconvenience]]"[http://twitter.com/#!/professorgreen/status/80919663818711040 Professor Green Twitter Status update 15 June 2011]. Their remix of Noisia's Machine Gun was used in a trailer and various TV Spots for [[Transformers: Dark of the Moon]].[http://www.trackitdown.net/news/show/104541.html Trackitdown - NOISIA / 16BIT SOUNDTRACK NEW TRANSFORMERS TRAILER!] 16bit won 'Best Mix' at the 2010 DubstepForum Awards for their 'Milky Pie Mix' and came 2nd top in the Best Producer category.[http://www.junodownload.com/plus/2010/03/01/skream-joker-joy-orbison-take-out-dubstep-forum-awards/ Juno Plus - Dubstep forum award winners] They have stated that they're working on their debut album for a 2012 release. ==Discography== * ''In The Death Car EP (12")'' (2008) * ''Swine Flu (12")'' (2009) * ''The Tale Of The Exploding Fist EP (12")'' (2009) * ''Panic (12")'' (2010) * ''FRZR9000/Skullcrack (12")'' (2011) * ''Dinosaurs/Boston Cream (12")'' (2011) ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * {{facebook|16bitmusic|16bit}} * {{twitter|16bit|16bit}} * {{myspace|16bitmusic|16bit}} * {{YouTube|u=16bitmusic|16bit}} * {{discogs artist|16 Bit (2)|16bit}} {{16bit}} {{Use dmy dates|date=July 2011}} {{DEFAULTSORT:16bit (Musicians)}} [[Category:Electronic music duos]] [[Category:English electronic music groups]] [[Category:Dubstep music groups]]
